column4: A box that I have has 22mb free of physical RAM, but has ~2G of swap. if physical RAM runs out, will I notice?
free -m reports the total mem in use and the mem acutally used after subtracting buffered stuff
yeah, thats how i saw that is has very little physical ram left.
thats normal, look in the free column ,the 2e value is the real fre memory for applications
ie, on a VM i'm running, i have 2mb of physical ram (only gave it 128mb), but 2G of swap.
well, as long as it wont run out of mem and like crash or something, im fine.
your actual mem is backed by swap, so its almost always dettrimental to assign very little memory and much hd swap to a vm
its a bad idea to give 2G of hd swap and 128mb RAM? why?
say you have 4GB of actual mem, and start 10 VMS wit 128MB mem and the rest HD swap
it will lead to extensive hd swapping while you still have plenty of mem left
your OS will back real mem with swap when necessary
well, the physical box only has 256mb of RAM to begin with.
ah, then why virtualize on that?
